brand_info.name: Barilla
brand_info.tagline: The Joy of Food for a Better Life
brand_info.positioning: Global food brand rooted in Italian culinary culture, focused on quality ingredients, everyday nourishment, and bringing people together around simple, good food.
brand_info.vision: The Joy of Food for a Better Life.
brand_info.mission: To bring people together through the joy of food, creating products made with care, quality ingredients, and respect for people and the planet.
brand_info.origin_story: Founded in 1877 in Parma, Italy by Pietro Barilla as a small bread and pasta shop, later growing into a global food company synonymous with Italian pasta culture.

brand_values.brand_promise: High-quality food products made with carefully selected ingredients, designed for everyday meals that nourish body, relationships, and culture.
differentiators: Strong focus on quality control and ingredient transparency
Global leadership in pasta with consistent taste and cooking performance
non_negotiables: Trust built through consistency and transparency

psychographics.lifestyle: People who value shared meals, family moments, and simple, well-prepared food as part of daily life
psychographics.behavior: Regular household purchase, brand loyalty built over time, preference for trusted food brands and consistent quality

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Emotional yet grounded, combining warmth and clarity with a focus on everyday life and shared moments

logo.primary_logo: Barilla wordmark inside the iconic red oval
logo.usage_rules: Always maintain the red oval integrity; never distort or recolor; ensure strong contrast
logo.lockup_behavior: Typically centered or placed prominently; often paired with food imagery
logo.safe_area: Minimum padding equals the height of the Barilla wordmark

color_system.color_usage_rules: Red and blue as core brand anchors; warm food tones used to enhance appetite appeal

typography.primary_font: Friendly modern serif or humanist sans-serif used in brand systems

layout_principles.cta_placement: Lower area or integrated within food scenes

preferred_photographers: Varies by market; consistent home-style food photography language
style.camera_feel: Inviting realism with a human, lived-in feel
style.pose_guidelines: Hands serving, sharing, cooking; natural gestures
style.casting_attitude: Real families and people; relaxed, genuine, inclusive

technical.lighting: Warm natural light or soft studio light mimicking daylight
technical.depth_of_field: Shallow to medium focusing on food texture
technical.color_grading: Warm, natural tones enhancing freshness and appetite

model_casting.diversity: High; inclusive representation of families and cultures

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Finished dishes and ingredients clearly visible and appetizing
product_presentation.styling_approach: Natural food styling; emphasis on freshness and simplicity

motion_rules.pacing: Slow to moderate, matching home-life rhythm

digital.tone_adjustment: More educational and recipe-driven online; emotional storytelling on social

platform_behavior.Instagram: Food close-ups, family moments, short recipes
platform_behavior.Website: Recipe hubs, product education, sustainability information
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Seasonal recipes, brand stories, product highlights

print.paper: Matte or semi-matte stock with warm color reproduction
print.cover_rules: Food hero imagery with clear Barilla logo and minimal copy
